resources.string: Cuisines:Biryani, North Indian, Mughlai, Indian, Kebab
SCO 388, Near Iffco chowk metro station, Sector 29, Gurgaon
Khasra 258, Lane-3, West End Marg, Saidulajab, Saket, New Delhi
Restaurant specialised in sukiyaki and shabu shabu.
Andaman and Nicobar F - 104/105, Curzon Road Hostel Kasturba Gandhi Marg, New Delhi - 110 001 Ph. 3782945
Punjab Tourist Information Centre, 214, Kanishka Shopping Plaza, 19, Ashok Road, New Delhi - 110 001 Ph. 3343055

CITYWALK is a shopping centre located in the Saket District Centre, in Saket, New Delhi. The 1,300,000 sq ft retail development is spread over 6 acres and includes a 4 km long multiplex, serviced apartments, offices and public spaces.
A-3, Saket District Centre, District Centre, Sector 6, Pushp Vihar, New Delhi, Delhi 110017
Great shopping mall.Selling of second hand items too.
PACIFIC MALL, TAGORE GARDEN, Pillar No. 464, Najafgarh Rd, New Delhi, 110018
DLF Emporio is a high-street shopping mall situated Vasant Kunj, New Delhi. In 2007, it was reported as one of the most expensive malls in the country with very high rental rates per month..
4, Nelson Mandela Road, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, Delhi 110070

The Red Fort is an epitome of the Mughal era in India and is the face of tourist attractions in Delhi. Built in 1638, it is an outstanding marvel of Mughal architecture made of red sand stone. Within its magnanimous walls, the chhata bazaar and an every evening sound and light show are special attractions.
Netaji Subhash Marg, Lal Qila, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006
Opening hours: 9 am to 6 pm. Closed on Mondays
Free for children under 15, INR 10 for Indians, and INR 250 for foreigners

India Gate is one monument that defines Delhi or India for that matter. It was built in 1931 as a memorial for martyrs of World War I and war in Afghanistan. At Rajpath, the structure looks amazing in evening lights. The gardens that line the structure are a must visit among the sightseeing places in Delhi.
Rajpath Marg, India Gate, New Delhi, Delhi 110001

Among the other places to visit in Delhi, Qutub Minar stands tall with its 73 meter tall brick minaret. Built by Qutub-ud-din Aibak, the structure has five stories abundant with chiseled carvings and scriptures.
Opening hours: Sunrise until sunset, Closed on Mondays
Entry fee: Free for children under 15, INR 10 for Indians INR 250 for foreigners

Famously known as the Lotus temple in the list of famous tourist places in Delhi, Lotus in the Bahai Temple symbolizes four religions namely Hinduism, Jainism, Buddhism and Islam. This temple belongs to the Bahai faith which proclaims that all people and religions are united. Worshippers of every religion are welcomed here.
Lotus Temple Rd, Bahapur, Shambhu Dayal Bagh, Kalkaji, New Delhi, Delhi 110019
Opening hours: from 9 am till sunset
